title: Can't send messages from Thunderbird through Gmail account
content: Over the years I've had to stop using several gmail addresses for 1 simple reason. Randomly, I begin getting this message when trying to send an email: Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.googlemail.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account settings / Outgoing server (SMTP)'. The password is correct, it's never changed. I can login to gmail online and login in with it. I can see my messages, but I can't login through Thunderbird. The stupid thing is I can download messages from the account, I just can't send any back. I've spent hours in total going through Gmail and Thunderbird settings and can't find where the fault lies and eventually have to just stop using the account. Can anyone suggest what the problem is?

title: omg please help! Have i really just lost all of my email?
content: Oh my goodness, please help me someone, I feel like I am about to throw up... I was changing to a new laptop... Have done so before... Copied my profile folder... When it was being copied, it said something about an error or something but I just "let it go" and clicked ok and then it appeared to finish transferring to the external drive so that I could move to new computer. In fact it didn't copy to drive, I moved it there... So it was no longer on my old laptop... I go back to new laptop and am having problems getting the profile to load with thunderbird... So i go back to my old one, discover that profile is missing, ok, i have a back up, put it back, it all loads ok but since as i said before it didn't apparently copy correctly, it all gets set up fine but i have lost ALL of my email! All of the account settings etc are fine but no email is there... I am devastated, I have years and years of stuff that I considered important.. Is there any way this can be fixed? Is there any place that I can find this email now that I no longer have the full profile as it was? I hope I have been clear... Please help! Thank you... I feel so foolish for thinking that I could simply do this like I had in the past and not realising the profile had not copied correctly... I feel sick, thank you for listening, any help is appreciated...
creator: xeniaaidonopoulou1971

title: stuck in Thunderbird "restart to upgrade" doom loop and can no longer use it
content:
For the past 3 days, I've been locked out of using Thunderbird email. When I try to open it, I get a "Your computer must be restarted to complete a previous upgrade of Thunderbird. Do you want to restart now ?" "Yes/No" option pop-up.

This is infuriating. After several hours, I'm still no closer to being able to use Thunderbird again.

If I choose to restart, nothing changes and I just get the doom loop pop-up again.

If I install uninstall (via Windows Control Panel), again I get stuck with the "Your computer must be restarted to complete a previous upgrade of Thunderbird. Do you want to restart now ?" message.

I can find no useful advice in the Thunderbird help and forums. It's recorded as a known issue. But no viable solutions found.

Using Windows 10. Looks like Thunderbird tried to update to 115.16.2 on 28-Oct-24 (not something I requested).

Please let me know how I can fix it.

And do something to fix this bug (which is a shocker).
creator: pgbennet

please provide some pointers to clarify this process. I am using AI to cover most issues, but there still seems to be an information gap somewhere.

any help is grately appreciated as this is a very frustrating outcome and I have a few more machines to deal with. thanks

title: Every start of Thunderbird 128.4.0esr on Windows 11 I get the message: "Zum Ausführen der gewünschten Aktion ist kein E-Mail-Programm zugeordnet. ..."
content:
Every start of Thunderbird 128.4.0esr (64bit) on Windows 11 (64bit) I get a dialog with the message: "Zum Ausführen der gewünschten Aktion ist kein E-Mail-Programm zugeordnet. Installieren Sie ein entsprechendes E-Mail-Programm, oder erstellen Sie in der Systemsteuerung unter "Standardprogramme" eine Zuordnung, wenn bereits ein Programm installiert ist."

Thunderbird is the standard E-Mail programm in "Standardprogramme". Reinstallation of Thunderbird did not change the behavior. User account is not administrator. For installing Thunderbird, the administrator password was requested. Windows 11 is freshly installed. Thunderbird has been installed as one of the first programms. Windows is: Windows 11 Pro, Version 24H2, installed 10.10.2024, build 26100.2033. Dialog appeared right from the beginning, even before a profile was imported, and at every program start.

I post-installed two extentions, but the dialog showed up before and after installation and also if I disable them. The dialog appears right after the Thunderbird window has been created (that is after the master password entry of the profile).

Playing around with settings, I experienced, that switching the Thunderbird language from German to English (US), the dialog and message disappear. Could you please fix it with the German language pack?

title: Gmail Inbox on Thunderbird is suddenly empty
content:
I've used Thunderbird to retrieve Gmail messages for years (via pop.gmail.com), and my Inbox had thousands of messages in it. Starting yesterday, my Gmail Inbox on Thunderbird shows up as having 0 messages in it. Whereas, my Gmail Sent folder is still fine on Thunderbird, and the other e-mail account I use Thunderbird with still has its Inbox fully intact.

I am using MacOS 10.13.6. I just now updated Thunderbird to version 115.16.2 but the Gmail Inbox is still empty. It can actually still receive new messages but the old ones are gone without a trace. And on the Gmail web site, all the old messages are still there (including a bunch that I had deleted on Thunderbird).

Is there a specific file corresponding to Thunderbird's copy of my Gmail Inbox that I could try to restore using TimeMachine backups?

Failing that, is there a way to prompt Thunderbird to download every message that is currently in my online Gmail Inbox?

Thank you very much for any help you can offer.
creator: jep1978

creator: retainerdirect

title: Thunderbird Intermittent freezing of "Reply" or "Send Message" from address book .
content: I am running an HP desktop under Linux Mint, and my installation of TB works flawlessly. My wife's install on a Lenovo ThinkPad T530, again running Mint, periodically, and at random intervals, suddenly stops working to replies to incoming emails. The incoming mail always works perfectly, but if one hits Reply to a message, a screen opens, with the message being replied to, properly displayed, but the Subject field frozen, and the text window to enter the reply equally frozen. When in this condition, attempts to send a new message to the sender, by going through the Address Book, choosing the recipient by name and then Write, has exactly the same issue - frozen input fields. The only resolution is to reboot the computer, when it all works normally until the next random freeze. (Closing TB and reopening it does not fix it.) Mint takes charge of updates of TB, and we have kept all updates up to date, as well as Mint itself, so I do not think this is an update issue. (We currently have TB 115.16.0esr) The problem happens only on the older Lenovo ThinkPad laptop, not on my HP desktop. Anything further I can add to document the situation? Any ideas, (other than "Reboot whenever it happens", (anywhere from a day or two, to weeks))?
creator: dmaxwell1

title: Address book missing
content:

However if I close and re-open Thunderbird the address book has gone. After trying this numeous times I saw a message "Migrating cardbook DBImage 5/8" as shown in the attached screenshot. The issue isn't with Cardbook as the same happens if I open the Address Book from the top-right menu
